senses.de: Make something or someone smaller in size, amount, or extent
senses.ex: She reduced her weekly hours of work from 40 to 25.

Tips.title: Physical reduction
Tips.description: Used when talking about decreasing the physical size, amount, or number of tangible items.
Tips.example: To save space, companies reduce packaging sizes.

Tips.title: Quantity over time
Tips.description: Emphasizes a gradual decrease in quantity or intensity over a period of time.
Tips.example: We need to reduce energy consumption gradually.

Tips.title: Not elimination
Tips.description: Reduce means to lessen, not completely eliminate something.
Tips.example: The doctor recommended reducing sugar, not cutting it out entirely.

senses.ex: The issue was reduced to a few simple questions.

Tips.title: Complex to simple
Tips.description: Refers to taking something complex and making it easier to understand.
Tips.example: Reduce a complex argument to a simple statement.

Tips.title: Focus on core
Tips.description: Involves identifying and concentrating on the most important elements of something.
Tips.example: They reduced the story to its key themes.

senses.de: Change food or another substance into a simpler form
senses.ex: The body reduces food to nutrients.

Tips.title: Chemical transformation
Tips.description: Describes the process of changing substances into different or simpler forms.
Tips.example: Heat can reduce this compound to a more basic form.

Tips.title: Cooking context
Tips.description: Common in cooking to describe concentrating flavors by cooking down liquid.
Tips.example: Reduce the sauce for twenty minutes to thicken it.

senses.ex: Over time, his influence in the company was reduced.

Tips.title: Power dynamics
Tips.description: Often used in business or politics to express loss of power, influence or authority.
Tips.example: The merger reduced the manager's role in the company.

Tips.title: Subtle change
Tips.description: Suggests a subtle or less obvious diminution, not necessarily immediate or direct.
Tips.example: New regulations have slowly reduced his control over the project.

senses.ex: She tried to reduce him by making fun of his achievements.

Tips.title: Emotional effect
Tips.description: Can indicate making someone feel lesser in value or importance, often in a hurtful way.
Tips.example: His comments about her work reduced her confidence.

Tips.title: Social perception
Tips.description: Used to express how someone's status or reputation is perceived as lowered by others.
Tips.example: The scandal reduced him in the eyes of his peers.

Curtail.wordDefinition:
Curtail means to cut back or shorten something, often to a significant degree. This term is used when there is a need to reduce something quickly and significantly.

For example, a government may curtail spending on certain programs during an economic crisis.

In summary, curtailing is a more drastic and immediate reduction, while reducing is a slower and more gradual reduction.

Cut back.wordDefinition:
Cut back means to decrease an amount or quantity of something that was previously used or consumed regularly. It usually implies a significant or drastic reduction.

But if they want to cut back on their spending, they may drastically reduce their shopping habits and only buy necessities.

Cut back is usually used when a more significant decrease is needed, while reduce can be used for both small and large decreases.

Decrease.wordDefinition:
Both decrease and reduce mean to make something smaller, but they are used in different situations.

Decrease is used when referring to a change in quantity or number. For example, if you have ten apples and you eat three, the number of apples has decreased from ten to seven.

Decrease refers to a change in quantity or number, while reduce refers to a change in size or intensity.

Diminish.wordDefinition:
Diminish means to make something smaller or weaker, usually gradually over time.

For example, a person's interest in a particular hobby may gradually diminish over time as they lose enthusiasm for it.

Diminish describes a gradual decrease while reduce is an immediate decrease.

Lessen.wordDefinition:
The words lessen and reduce both mean to make something smaller or decrease it.

However, lessen is usually used in reference to something like a feeling or a burden. For example, you might say that talking to a friend lessened your anxiety.

Similarly, you might say that an action you took lessened the stress on your family.

Low.wordDefinition:
Low refers to something that is already at a low level, while reduce means to make something lower or decrease it from its current level.

For example, if the price of a product is already low, we can say it is a low price.

However, if we want to make the price lower, we can reduce the price further.

Similarly, if someone's cholesterol levels are already low, we can say they have low cholesterol. But if we want to make their cholesterol levels lower, we can suggest ways to reduce their cholesterol, such as by eating a healthier diet or exercising more.

Low refers to something that is already low, while reduce means to make something lower than it currently is.

Minimize.wordDefinition:
Minimize means to make something as small as possible or to keep it to a minimum. It's used when you want to reduce the amount of something to the lowest possible level.

For example, people try to minimize stress by taking breaks or avoiding stressful situations.

Minimize is used when you want to make something as small as possible, while reduce is used when you want to make something smaller or decrease its quantity or size.

Shrink.wordDefinition:
Shrink also means to make something smaller in size, but it usually implies a decrease or loss in value or worth. For example, if a sweater shrinks in the wash, it may become too small to wear or lose its original quality.

In business, the term shrink is often used to describe the loss of inventory due to theft or damage.

Reduce focuses on making something smaller while maintaining its value, while shrink implies a decrease in value or worth in addition to physical size reduction.

quotes.Text: It's true that the original idea was mine, but what you see today is the work of probably tens of thousands of the world's best engineers, all concentrating on improving the product, reducing the cost, things of that sort.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Jack Kilby

quotes.Text: Reducing the price of AIDS drugs gave me so much satisfaction that I've been thinking what else I could do. One day, I thought, 'Let's look at cancer and see how we can spare cancer patients' unnecessary suffering.
quotes.Title: Indian Scientist
quotes.Name: Yusuf Hamied

quotes.Text: I don't get it when you get so much openness about the way movies are made, and the special effects and the behind-the-scenes stuff and all of that. I can't help but feel like this reduces it a little bit.
quotes.Title: Welsh Actor
quotes.Name: Christian Bale

quotes.Text: When you have law-abiding citizens who are actively ready to protect themselves and their family, that reduces crime.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Eric Greitens

quotes.Text: We have shared responsibility for global climate; we have to reduce climate change below 2 degrees Celsius.
quotes.Title: German Statesman
quotes.Name: Angela Merkel

quotes.Text: It is so hard to make important decisions that we have a great urge to reduce them to rules.
quotes.Title: Canadian Philosopher
quotes.Name: Ian Hacking

quotes.Text: Living in truth cannot be reduced to having access to full information.
quotes.Title: Public Servant
quotes.Name: Ivan Krastev

quotes.Text: Without peace, all other dreams vanish and are reduced to ashes.
quotes.Title: Indian Leader
quotes.Name: Jawaharlal Nehru

quotes.Text: I came to Congress to help reduce spending.
quotes.Title: American Politician
quotes.Name: Dave Reichert

quotes.Text: Practice helps you reduce your mistakes.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Nana Patekar
